example.eg: The guard patrolled around the building.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保镖，警卫，门卫, 守卫者

example.eg: The guard was called in to help deal with the situation.
example.egtrans: 警卫队被叫进来协助处理当前情形。

example.eg: The dog guarded the backyard.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 守卫, 保护, 守卫

example.eg: Rick was a guard on his high school basketball team.
example.egtrans: 高中篮球队中，里克担任后卫。

example.eg: Cody was lucky that he kept his hands behind the guard on the chainsaw when it slipped off of the branch.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保护器, 防护罩, 防卫

example.eg: The travel agent had warned Beth to guard against pickpockets when she traveled abroad.
example.egtrans: 那位旅游代理警告贝丝，要她出国旅游的时候小心扒手。

example.eg: Wear a sunhat to guard against sunburn.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保护，保卫, 防御，防卫

example.eg: The offer of early retirement caught me off guard; I hadn't guessed it was coming.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…惊讶, 趁…不备，使…措手不及, 搜救组织

dsense.name: crossing guard (US), lollipop lady, lollipop man (UK)

example.eg: The crossing guard at this intersection is very friendly; he kids around with the children and chats with the adult pedestrians.

dsense.name: eyecup, eye guard
dsense.guideword: (on optical device: eye rest) (光学仪器目用)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 眼罩, 眼环, 眼杯

example.eg: German shepherds make excellent guard dogs.
During the war, the Home Guard was composed mainly of men who weren't eligible for conscription.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 英国地方军, 地方志愿军

example.eg: They closed the pool because no lifeguard was available.

dsense.name: lower your guard, UK: lower your defences, US: lower your defenses

example.eg: He lowered his guard once he realized it was a friend.
She put her mouth guard in before playing rugby.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 防护牙托, 猝不及防地

example.eg: The thief took advantage of a moment when the shopkeeper was off guard.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 没有防备的, 意外的

example.eg: You need to be on guard for viral attacks against your computer.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 防备着地, 有所警戒地, 警惕地

example.eg: Dressed in red with white trim, the palace guard stood at the gate.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 宫廷警卫, 宫廷护卫

example.eg: The way she looks at me puts me on my guard.
The rearguard faced the greatest danger when the army was in retreat.
They accused their opponents of being in the rearguard of social change.
The security guard patrolled the shopping centre looking for rowdy schoolchildren.
example.egtrans: 保安在商店中心巡逻，留意那些吵闹的小学生。

dsense.name: shin guard
dsense.guideword: often plural (protective leg pads) (运动员佩戴的)
